Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<PlayerCommand>
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observer<PlayerCommand>
Implements the controller of the application Manages the model, links the remote views with the model, manages exceptions/errors generated in the model
Author:
Elia Ravella

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Controller​(Game g)
    class constructor

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addPlayer​(java.lang.String playerName, int age)
    adds the player to the game this function is called from the RemoteView at the beginning of the game, before the startGame() method is invoked
    void addWorker​(int row, int column)
    adds a worker to the board.
    void changeTurnPlayer()
    Changes the player controlling the board this function removes the actual turn player and replaces it with the next on the list it also sends a command to the gods of the former turn player to resets some variables this method triggers an update of the client
    void commitCommand​(java.lang.String player, Command command, int workerID)
    actually modifies the mode this function passes the "command" from the user to the divinity, that then modifies the Board accordingly
    Player getTurnPlayer()  
    void startGame()
    starts the game
    void update​(PlayerCommand message)
    the method update is triggered by a remoteview change: it's the standard notify-update interaction of the Observer pattern it decodes the message from the client and manages the action to do on the model

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller​(Game g)
      class constructor
      Parameters:
      g - the instance of the class Game that encapsulates the whole match

  • Method Details

    • commitCommand

      public void commitCommand​(java.lang.String player, Command command, int workerID)
      actually modifies the mode this function passes the "command" from the user to the divinity, that then modifies the Board accordingly
      Parameters:
      player - the player in control of the (Remote)View
      command - the operation the player is wishing to do
      workerID - the number representing the worker (0, 1)

    • addWorker

      public void addWorker​(int row, int column)
      adds a worker to the board. the worker added is owned by the turn player as the "adding worker" procedure is turn-based. if the operation is "illegal" a notify is sent to the clients
      Parameters:
      row - the x axis coordinate to be added
      column - the y axis coordinate to be added

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(java.lang.String playerName, int age)
      adds the player to the game this function is called from the RemoteView at the beginning of the game, before the startGame() method is invoked
      Parameters:
      playerName - the player's name
      age - the player's age

    • changeTurnPlayer

      public void changeTurnPlayer()
      Changes the player controlling the board this function removes the actual turn player and replaces it with the next on the list it also sends a command to the gods of the former turn player to resets some variables this method triggers an update of the client

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      starts the game

    • getTurnPlayer

      public Player getTurnPlayer()
      Returns:
      the turn player memorised in Board

    • update

      public void update​(PlayerCommand message)
      the method update is triggered by a remoteview change: it's the standard notify-update interaction of the Observer pattern it decodes the message from the client and manages the action to do on the model
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<PlayerCommand>
      Parameters:
      message - the update content
